# ClawPilot - LLM Context (Full)

> ClawPilot is managed OpenClaw: hosted, maintained, and kept available so users can focus on outcomes.

## Overview

OpenClaw is powerful, but self-hosting can become a side project. ClawPilot handles hosting, setup, updates, and reliability so users can run OpenClaw in their chats without infrastructure overhead.

## What is OpenClaw?

OpenClaw is an open-source personal AI assistant that:
- Works inside messaging apps (WhatsApp, Telegram, Slack, Discord, Signal, iMessage, Teams, WebChat)
- Handles conversations and delegated tasks
- Can connect to approved tools and systems
- Is community-built and open source

## What is ClawPilot?

ClawPilot is the hosted layer for OpenClaw:
- Managed infrastructure and uptime
- Setup and updates handled by ClawPilot
- Account-first onboarding
- Permission-aware controls for actions and integrations

## Key Features

### Managed OpenClaw Hosting
- No hardware purchases required
- No server deployments or scaling setup
- No uptime babysitting

### Multi-Platform Gateway
Connect to multiple messaging platforms through one OpenClaw gateway:
- WhatsApp
- Telegram
- Slack
- Discord
- Signal
- iMessage
- Microsoft Teams
- WebChat

### Control and Safety
- Users approve what OpenClaw can access
- Sensitive actions can require explicit confirmation
- Activity can be reviewed after tasks run

## Typical Use Cases

- Email support and follow-ups
- Calendar planning and reminders
- Routine tasks and personal workflows
- Chat-based "do this for me" delegation

Additional use cases include business operations, customer support, and outbound workflows. More capabilities are available through Clawhub.
